lustre/tests/mpi/write_append_truncate.c

00026 /*
00027  * Copyright (c) 2003, 2010, Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved.
00028  * Use is subject to license terms.

00032 /*
00033  * This file is part of Lustre, http://www.lustre.org/
00034  * Lustre is a trademark of Sun Microsystems, Inc.
00035  *
00036  * lustre/tests/write_append_truncate.c
00037  *
00038  * Each loop does 3 things:
00039  *   - truncate file to zero (not via ftruncate though, to test O_APPEND)
00040  *   - write a "chunk" of data (should be at file offset 0 after truncate)
00041  *   - on each of two threads either append or truncate-up the file
00042  *
00043  * If the truncate happened first, we should have a hole in the file.
00044  * If the append happened first, we should have truncated the file down.
00045  *
00046  * WRITE_SIZE_MAX and APPEND_SIZE_MAX are large enough to cross a stripe.
00047  *
00048  * compile: mpicc -g -Wall -o write_append_truncate write_append_truncate.c
00049  * run:     mpirun -np 2 -machlist <hostlist file> write_append_truncate <file>
00050  *  or:     pdsh -w <two hosts> write_append_truncate <file>
00051  *  or:     prun -n 2 [-N 2] write_append_truncate <file>
00052  */
00053 
00054 #include <stdlib.h>
00055 #include <stdio.h>
00056 #include <stdarg.h>
00057 #include <sys/types.h>
00058 #include <sys/stat.h>
00059 #include <fcntl.h>
00060 #include <errno.h>
00061 #include <time.h>
00062 #include <string.h>
00063 #include <unistd.h>
00064 #include <getopt.h>
00065 #include "mpi.h"
00066 
00067 #define DEFAULT_ITER    10000
00068 
00069 #define WRITE_SIZE_MAX  1234567
00070 #define APPEND_SIZE_MAX 1234567
00071 #define TRUNC_SIZE_MAX  1234567
00072 
00073 #define STATUS_FMT "WR %c %7d/%#08x, AP %c %7d/%#08x, TR@ %7d/%#08x"
00074 
00075 #define HOSTNAME_SIZE 50
00076 char hostname[HOSTNAME_SIZE];
00077 #define FNAMES_MAX 256
00078 
00079 void usage(char *prog)
00080 {
00081         printf("usage: %s [-a append_max] [-C] [-n nloops] [-s seed]\n"
00082                "\t\t[-t trunc_max] [-T] [-v] [-w write_max] <filename> ...\n", prog);
00083         printf("\t-a append_max: maximum size of append, default %u bytes\n",
00084                APPEND_SIZE_MAX);
00085         printf("\t-C: 'classic' checks (on file 0)\n");
00086         printf("\t-n nloops: count of loops to run, default %u\n",DEFAULT_ITER);
00087         printf("\t-s seed: random seed to use, default {current time}\n");
00088         printf("\t-t trunc_max: maximum size of truncate, default %u bytes\n",
00089                TRUNC_SIZE_MAX);
00090         printf("\t-T: 'classic' truncates (on file 0)\n");
00091         printf("\t-w write_max: maximum size of write, default %u bytes\n",
00092                WRITE_SIZE_MAX);
00093         printf("\t-W: 'classic' writes (on rank 0, file 0)\n");
00094         printf("\t-v: run in verbose mode (repeat for more verbosity)\n");
00095         printf("\tfilename for each mountpoint of same filesystem on a node\n");
00096         printf("\b%s must be run with at least 2 processes\n", prog);
00097 
00098         MPI_Finalize();
00099         exit(1);
00100 }
00101 
00102 /* Print process rank, loop count, message, and exit (i.e. a fatal error) */
00103 void rprintf(int rank, int loop, int error, const char *fmt, ...)
00104 __attribute__ ((format (printf, 4, 5)));
00105 
00106 void rprintf(int rank, int loop, int error, const char *fmt, ...)
00107 {
00108         va_list       ap;
00109 
00110         printf("r=%2u", rank);
00111         if (loop >= 0)
00112                 printf(" l=%04u", loop);
00113         if (error != 0)
00114                 printf(" %s", hostname);
00115         printf(": ");
00116 
00117         va_start(ap, fmt);
00118 
00119         vprintf(fmt, ap);
00120 
00121         if (error != 0)
00122                 MPI_Abort(MPI_COMM_WORLD, error);
00123 }
00124 
00125 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00126 {
00127         int n, nloops = DEFAULT_ITER;
00128         int nfnames = 0, ifnames, fd;
00129         int rank = -1, nproc, ret;
00130         unsigned write_max = WRITE_SIZE_MAX;
00131         unsigned append_max = APPEND_SIZE_MAX;
00132         unsigned write_size = 0, append_size = 0, trunc_size = 0;
00133         unsigned trunc_max = 0, trunc_offset = 0;
00134         char *append_buf;
00135         char *write_buf;
00136         char *read_buf = NULL;
00137         char *trunc_buf = NULL;
00138         int seed = time(0);
00139         int done;
00140         int error;
00141         int verbose = 0;
00142         int classic_check = 0, classic_trunc = 0, classic_write = 0;
00143         char write_char = 'A', append_char = 'a';
00144         char *fnames[FNAMES_MAX], *end;
00145         char *prog = "write_append_truncate";
00146         int c;
00147 
00148         error = MPI_Init(&argc, &argv);
00149         if (error != MPI_SUCCESS)
00150                 printf("%s: MPI_Init failed: %d\n", prog, error);
00151         else if (verbose > 2)
00152                 printf("%s: MPI_Init succeeded\n", prog);
00153 
00154         prog = strrchr(argv[0], '/');
00155         if (prog == NULL)
00156                 prog = argv[0];
00157         else
00158                 prog++;
00159 
00160         while ((c = getopt(argc, argv, "a:cCn:s:t:Tvw:W")) != -1) {
00161                 switch(c) {
00162                 case 'a':
00163                         append_max = strtoul(optarg, &end, 0);
00164                         if (append_max < 2 || *end) {
00165                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: bad append option '%s'\n",
00166                                         prog, optarg);
00167                                 usage(prog);
00168                         }
00169                         break;
00170                 case 'C':
00171                         classic_check++;
00172                         break;
00173                 case 'n':
00174                         nloops = strtoul(optarg, &end, 0);
00175                         if (nloops == 0 || *end) {
00176                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: bad nloops option '%s'\n",
00177                                         prog, optarg);
00178                                 usage(prog);
00179                         }
00180                         break;
00181                 case 's':
00182                         seed = strtoul(optarg, &end, 0);
00183                         if (*end) {
00184                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: bad seed option '%s'\n",
00185                                         prog, optarg);
00186                                 usage(prog);
00187                         }
00188                         break;
00189                 case 't':
00190                         trunc_max = strtoul(optarg, &end, 0);
00191                         if (*end) {
00192                                 fprintf(stderr,"%s: bad truncate option '%s'\n",
00193                                         prog, optarg);
00194                                 usage(prog);
00195                         }
00196                         break;
00197                 case 'T':
00198                         classic_trunc++;
00199                         break;
00200                 case 'v':
00201                         verbose++;
00202                         break;
00203                 case 'w':
00204                         write_max = strtoul(optarg, &end, 0);
00205                         if (write_max < 2 || *end) {
00206                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: bad write option '%s'\n",
00207                                         prog, optarg);
00208                                 usage(prog);
00209                         }
00210                         break;
00211                 case 'W':
00212                         classic_write++;
00213                         break;
00214                 default:
00215                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: unknown option '%c'\n", prog, c);
00216                         usage(prog);
00217                 }
00218         }
00219 
00220         srand(seed);
00221 
00222         if (argc == optind) {
00223                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: missing filename argument\n", prog);
00224                 usage(prog);
00225         }
00226 
00227         if (argc > optind + FNAMES_MAX) {
00228                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: too many extra options\n", prog);
00229                 usage(prog);
00230         }
00231 
00232         while (optind < argc)
00233                 fnames[nfnames++] = argv[optind++];
00234 
00235         error = MPI_Comm_rank(MPI_COMM_WORLD, &rank);
00236         if (verbose > 2 || error != MPI_SUCCESS)
00237                 rprintf(rank, -1, error != MPI_SUCCESS, "MPI_Comm_rank: %d\n",
00238                         error);
00239 
00240         error = MPI_Comm_size(MPI_COMM_WORLD, &nproc);
00241         if (verbose > 2 || error != MPI_SUCCESS)
00242                 rprintf(rank, -1, error != MPI_SUCCESS, "MPI_Comm_size: %d\n",
00243                         error);
00244 
00245         if (nproc < 2)
00246                 rprintf(rank, -1, 1, "%s: must run with at least 2 processes\n",
00247                         prog);
00248 
00249         append_buf = malloc(append_max);
00250         if (append_buf == NULL)
00251                 rprintf(rank, -1, 1,"%s: error allocating append_buf %u\n",
00252                         prog, append_max);
00253 
00254         write_buf = malloc(write_max);
00255         if (write_buf == NULL)
00256                 rprintf(rank, -1, 1, "%s: error allocating write_buf %u\n",
00257                         prog, write_max);
00258 
00259         if (gethostname(hostname, HOSTNAME_SIZE) < 0)
00260                 rprintf(rank, -1, 1, "%s: gethostname failed: %s\n",
00261                         prog, strerror(errno));
00262 
00263         if (rank == 0) {
00264                 int max_size = write_max + (trunc_max ?: append_max)+append_max;
00265 
00266                 fd = open(fnames[0], O_WRONLY|O_CREAT|O_TRUNC, 0666);
00267                 rprintf(rank,-1, fd<0, "create %s, max size: %u, seed %u: %s\n",
00268                         fnames[0], max_size, seed, strerror(errno));
00269                 close(fd);
00270 
00271                 trunc_buf = calloc(1, trunc_max ?: append_max);
00272                 if (trunc_buf == NULL)
00273                         rprintf(rank,-1,1,"%s: error allocating trunc_buf %u\n",
00274                                 prog, trunc_max ?: append_max);
00275 
00276                 /* initial write + truncate up + append */
00277                 read_buf = malloc(max_size);
00278                 if (read_buf == NULL)
00279                         rprintf(rank,-1,1,"%s: error allocating read_buf %u\n",
00280                                 prog, max_size);
00281         }
00282 
00283         error = MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00284         if (verbose > 2 || error != MPI_SUCCESS)
00285                 rprintf(rank, -1, error != MPI_SUCCESS,
00286                         "prep MPI_Barrier: %d\n", error);
00287 
00288         ifnames = rank % nfnames;
00289         fd = open(fnames[ifnames], O_RDWR | O_APPEND);
00290         if (verbose || fd < 0)
00291                 rprintf(rank, -1, errno, "open '%s' (%u): %s\n",
00292                         fnames[ifnames], ifnames, strerror(errno));
00293 
00294         for (n = 0; n < nloops; n++) {
00295                 /* Initialized only to quiet stupid GCC warnings */
00296                 unsigned write_rank = 0, append_rank = n, trunc_rank = n + 1;
00297                 unsigned mpi_shared_vars[6];
00298 
00299                 /* reset the environment */
00300                 write_char = 'A' + (n % 26);
00301                 append_char = 'a' + (n % 26);
00302 
00303                 if (rank == 0) {
00304                         write_size = (rand() % (write_max - 1)) + 1;
00305                         append_size = (rand() % (append_max - 1)) + 1;
00306                         trunc_size = (append_size == 1) ? 1 :
00307                                      (rand() % ((trunc_max?: append_size)-1))+1;
00308                         trunc_offset = write_size + trunc_size;
00309 
00310                         if (verbose || n % 1000 == 0)
00311                                 rprintf(rank, n, 0, STATUS_FMT"\n",
00312                                         write_char, write_size, write_size,
00313                                         append_char, append_size, append_size,
00314                                         trunc_offset, trunc_offset);
00315 
00316                         write_rank = (classic_write ? 0 : rand()) % nproc;
00317                         do {
00318                                 append_rank = (classic_write ? n : rand()) %
00319                                                                 nproc;
00320                                 /* We can't allow the append rank be the same
00321                                  * as the classic_trunc trunc_rank, or we will
00322                                  * spin here forever. */
00323                         } while (append_rank == (n + 1) % nproc);
00324                         do {
00325                                 trunc_rank = (classic_trunc? (n + 1) : rand()) %
00326                                                                 nproc;
00327                         } while (trunc_rank == append_rank);
00328 
00329                         mpi_shared_vars[0] = write_size;
00330                         mpi_shared_vars[1] = append_size;
00331                         mpi_shared_vars[2] = trunc_size;
00332                         mpi_shared_vars[3] = write_rank;
00333                         mpi_shared_vars[4] = append_rank;
00334                         mpi_shared_vars[5] = trunc_rank;
00335                 }
00336 
00337                 error = MPI_Bcast(&mpi_shared_vars, 6,
00338                                   MPI_INT, 0, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00339                 if (verbose > 2 || error != MPI_SUCCESS)
00340                         rprintf(rank, n, error != MPI_SUCCESS,
00341                                 "MPI_Bcast mpi_shared_vars"
00342                                 "[%u, %u, %u, %u, %u, %u]: %d\n",
00343                                 mpi_shared_vars[0], mpi_shared_vars[1],
00344                                 mpi_shared_vars[2], mpi_shared_vars[3],
00345                                 mpi_shared_vars[4], mpi_shared_vars[5], error);
00346 
00347                 if (rank != 0) {
00348                         write_size  = mpi_shared_vars[0];
00349                         append_size = mpi_shared_vars[1];
00350                         trunc_size  = mpi_shared_vars[2];
00351                         write_rank  = mpi_shared_vars[3];
00352                         append_rank = mpi_shared_vars[4];
00353                         trunc_rank  = mpi_shared_vars[5];
00354 
00355                         trunc_offset = write_size + trunc_size;
00356                 }
00357 
00358                 if (rank == write_rank || rank == 0)
00359                         memset(write_buf, write_char, write_max);
00360 
00361                 if (rank == write_rank) {
00362                         ifnames = (classic_write ? 0 : rand()) % nfnames;
00363                         ret = truncate(fnames[ifnames], 0);
00364                         if (verbose > 1 || ret != 0)
00365                                 rprintf(rank, n, ret,
00366                                         "initial truncate %s (%u) @ 0: %s\n",
00367                                         fnames[ifnames], ifnames,
00368                                         strerror(errno));
00369 
00370                         done = 0;
00371                         do {
00372                                 ret = write(fd, write_buf+done,write_size-done);
00373                                 if (verbose > 1 || ret < 0) {
00374                                         rprintf(rank, n,
00375                                                 ret < 0 && errno != EINTR,
00376                                                 "write %d/%d @ %d: %s\n",
00377                                                 ret + done, write_size, done,
00378                                                 strerror(errno));
00379                                         if (ret < 0 && errno != EINTR)
00380                                                 break;
00381                                 }
00382                                 if (ret > 0)
00383                                         done += ret;
00384                         } while (done != write_size);
00385                 }
00386 
00387                 if (rank == append_rank || rank == 0)
00388                         memset(append_buf, append_char, append_size);
00389 
00390                 error = MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00391                 if (verbose > 2 || error != MPI_SUCCESS)
00392                         rprintf(rank, n, error != MPI_SUCCESS,
00393                                 "start MPI_Barrier: %d\n", error);
00394 
00395                 /* Do the race */
00396                 if (rank == append_rank) {
00397                         done = 0;
00398                         do {
00399                                 ret = write(fd, append_buf + done,
00400                                             append_size - done);
00401                                 if (ret < 0) {
00402                                         rprintf(rank, n, errno != EINTR,
00403                                                 "append %u/%u: %s\n",
00404                                                 ret + done, append_size,
00405                                                 strerror(errno));
00406                                         if (errno != EINTR)
00407                                                 break;
00408                                 } else if (verbose > 1 || ret != append_size) {
00409                                         rprintf(rank, n, ret != append_size,
00410                                                 "append %u/%u\n",
00411                                                 ret + done, append_size);
00412                                 }
00413                                 if (ret > 0)
00414                                         done += ret;
00415                         } while (done != append_size);
00416                 } else if (rank == trunc_rank) {
00417                         /* XXX: truncating the same file descriptor as the
00418                          *      append on a single node causes this test
00419                          *      to fail currently (2009-02-01). */
00420                         ifnames = (classic_trunc ? rank : rand()) % nfnames;
00421                         ret = truncate(fnames[ifnames], trunc_offset);
00422                         if (verbose > 1 || ret != 0)
00423                                 rprintf(rank, n, ret,
00424                                         "truncate %s (%u) @ %u: %s\n",
00425                                         fnames[ifnames], ifnames,
00426                                         trunc_offset, strerror(errno));
00427                 }
00428 
00429                 error = MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00430                 if (verbose > 2 || error != MPI_SUCCESS)
00431                         rprintf(rank, n, error != MPI_SUCCESS,
00432                                 "end MPI_Barrier: %d\n", error);
00433 
00434                 error = 0;
00435 
00436                 /* Check the result */
00437                 if (rank == 0) {
00438                         char *tmp_buf;
00439                         struct stat st = { 0 };
00440 
00441                         ifnames = classic_check ? 0 : (rand() % nfnames);
00442                         ret = stat(fnames[ifnames], &st);
00443                         if (verbose > 1 || ret != 0)
00444                                 rprintf(rank, n, ret,
00445                                         "stat %s (%u) size %llu: %s\n",
00446                                         fnames[ifnames], ifnames,
00447                                         (long long)st.st_size, strerror(errno));
00448 
00449                         ret = lseek(fd, 0, SEEK_SET);
00450                         if (ret != 0)
00451                                 rprintf(rank, n, ret, "lseek 0: %s\n",
00452                                         strerror(errno));
00453 
00454                         done = 0;
00455                         do {
00456                                 ret = read(fd, read_buf+done, st.st_size-done);
00457                                 if (verbose > 1 || ret <= 0) {
00458                                         rprintf(rank, n, ret <= 0,
00459                                                 "read %d/%llu @ %u: %s\n",
00460                                                 ret, (long long)st.st_size-done,
00461                                                 done, ret != 0 ?
00462                                                 strerror(errno) : "short read");
00463                                 }
00464                                 done += ret;
00465                         } while (done != st.st_size);
00466 
00467                         if (memcmp(read_buf, write_buf, write_size)) {
00468                                 rprintf(rank, n, 0, "WRITE bad "
00469                                         "[0-%d]/[0-%#x] != %c\n",
00470                                         write_size - 1, write_size - 1,
00471                                         write_char);
00472                                 error = 1;
00473                         }
00474 
00475                         tmp_buf = read_buf + write_size;
00476 
00477                         if (st.st_size == trunc_offset) {
00478                                 /* Check case 1: first append then truncate */
00479                                 int tmp_size, tmp_offset;
00480 
00481                                 tmp_size = trunc_size < append_size ?
00482                                                 trunc_size : append_size;
00483                                 tmp_offset = write_size + tmp_size;
00484 
00485                                 if (memcmp(tmp_buf, append_buf, tmp_size)) {
00486                                         rprintf(rank, n, 0,"trunc-after-APPEND "
00487                                                 "bad [%d-%d]/[%#x-%#x] != %c\n",
00488                                                 write_size, tmp_offset - 1,
00489                                                 write_size, tmp_offset - 1,
00490                                                 append_char);
00491                                         error = 1;
00492                                 } else if (trunc_size > append_size &&
00493                                            memcmp(tmp_buf+append_size,trunc_buf,
00494                                                   trunc_size - append_size)) {
00495                                         rprintf(rank, n, 0,"TRUNC-after-append "
00496                                                 "bad [%d-%d]/[%#x-%#x] != 0\n",
00497                                                 tmp_offset, trunc_offset - 1,
00498                                                 tmp_offset, trunc_offset - 1);
00499                                         error = 1;
00500                                 }
00501                         } else {
00502                                 int expected_size = trunc_offset + append_size;
00503                                 /* Check case 2: first truncate then append */
00504                                 if (st.st_size != expected_size) {
00505                                         rprintf(rank, n, 0,"APPEND-after-trunc "
00506                                                 "bad file size %llu != %u\n",
00507                                                 (long long)st.st_size,
00508                                                 expected_size);
00509                                         error = 1;
00510                                 }
00511 
00512                                 if (memcmp(tmp_buf, trunc_buf, trunc_size)) {
00513                                         rprintf(rank, n, 0,"append-after-TRUNC "
00514                                                 "bad [%d-%d]/[%#x-%#x] != 0\n",
00515                                                 write_size, trunc_offset - 1,
00516                                                 write_size, trunc_offset - 1);
00517                                         error = 1;
00518                                 } else if (memcmp(read_buf + trunc_offset,
00519                                                   append_buf, append_size)) {
00520                                         rprintf(rank, n, 0,"APPEND-after-trunc "
00521                                                 "bad [%d-%d]/[%#x-%#x] != %c\n",
00522                                                 trunc_offset, expected_size - 1,
00523                                                 trunc_offset, expected_size - 1,
00524                                                 append_char);
00525                                         error = 1;
00526                                 }
00527                         }
00528 
00529                         if (error == 1) {
00530                                 char command[4096];
00531 
00532                                 rprintf(rank, n, 0, STATUS_FMT"\n",
00533                                         write_char, write_size, write_size,
00534                                         append_char, append_size, append_size,
00535                                         trunc_offset, trunc_offset);
00536 
00537                                 sprintf(command, "od -Ax -a %s", fnames[0]);
00538                                 ret = system(command);
00539                                 MPI_Abort(MPI_COMM_WORLD, 1);
00540                         }
00541                 }
00542         }
00543 
00544         if (rank == 0 || verbose)
00545                 printf("r=%2u n=%4u: "STATUS_FMT"\nPASS\n", rank, n - 1,
00546                        write_char, write_size, write_size,
00547                        append_char, append_size, append_size,
00548                        trunc_offset, trunc_offset);
00549 
00550         close(fd);
00551 
00552         if (rank == 0) {
00553                 ifnames = rand() % nfnames;
00554                 ret = unlink(fnames[ifnames]);
00555                 if (ret != 0)
00556                         printf("%s: unlink %s failed: %s\n",
00557                                prog, fnames[ifnames], strerror(errno));
00558         }
00559 
00560         MPI_Finalize();
00561         return 0;
00562 }
